title: Remember when people complained about the SR Update
body:
They said they would quit the game if it wasn't changed back to how it was.
Why are they still playing?

These people who are now complaining about the HUD update.
I bet they'll still be playing in six months too.

replies.body: Exactly right, my friend. People fear change.
Bar-room  philosophy aside, Riot were aware the vast majority of PBE testers said "don't release", so what do they do?

No, it was the vocal majority that said for it to not be released.

The people who either don't care or like it didn't say anything, because they didn't need to.

This, basically, just because you complain, and that covers the majority of opinions, doesn't mean it's accurate.

Of the amount of PBE players there are, the amount that complained was actually the minority.
Not according to the NA boards

right, because in NA a majority of players use/post on boards...... 

the same applies as here. people that post are generally the ones that dont like it and want to complain and share that opinion. the people that like it or are indifferent generally will not bother to post that opinion.

You could say that about anything.
Point is , alot of people ARE unhappy with the new HUD.  Course you could argue that any new change will have i'ts haters and thats certainly true.  

Why not give players the option in config to swap back to the old HUD?

because then what is the point of changing it in the first place. its called progression. the fact that some people don't like it (after only like 1 day of using it) is irrelevant. do you cry for companies to give you an option to revert back to an old website when they change it?

Actually, the point of doing anything from a business model (and lets be clear, Riot is _purely _business) is to best meet and satisfy your  customer's needs.

If a significant portion of your clients don't like the way you do things, you run the risk of disinterest and losing that client base.  I'm not going to suggest this is happening in this instance,  but clearly many are unhappy at the new changes and lack of consultation over them.   Taking the simplistic approach of "you'll get used to it" smacks of arrogance and in the end, you may be just flogging a dead horse.

>If a significant portion of your clients don't like the way you do things

This isn't the case, you keep arguing this, but it just simply isn't true.

The majority of players either don't care and are going to adapt, or like the new hud, they just aren't on the boards (NA, OCE or PBE) to have a little fucking circle jerk about it.

The point is, having two HUDs that players can switch between means more coding, more coding increases the chance for error, and increases the size of the game.

Yeah a HUD is small, but if Riot listen to people for this, then they have to listen to people that wanted an option to switch between old SR textures and the new ones, which would what double the size of the game?

If you make compromises you will fail.
In a game like this it means doubling the coding and quadrupling the chance for bugs and other errors to occur.

Besides why would anyone complain about this new HUD?
It fits better with the new look for the game.
It displays information better and clearer.
It displays information was cumbersome to access before and caused delays in gameplay because of.

you seem to be forgetting that riot is trying to meet future customer needs. corporation's focus on GROWTH. they don't want to make the same profit and keep the same player base, they want to continually increase their profits and player base. this is called progression. they can't just keep the same old thing forever, they need to future proof their game and keep with the times. new generations of players won't know what the old hud was. older generations will eventually stop playing.

Because why do Riot have to do that sort of coding?

Spend a few dozen games getting used to this and the new Hud is better then the old one.

>Of the amount of PBE players there are, the amount that complained was actually the minority.

.

>Not according to the NA boards

*slowclap*
http://puu.sh/j6PqM/ec16d141ad.jpg
Change is .... GOood {{champion:121}}

That was so much different to what we have here, and I still prefer old SR, but now this HUD has literally made information less legible and forced your brain too take more time analyzing what is there by cramming it all into a corner.

The fact you compared the changing of a map to a changing of HUD just shows your ignorance to the subject rofl.

Oh yeah, and I was one complaining about new SR, and i play about 90% less and have not spent a cent on RP since. although it was not just the map change that irritated me, but that was one of the factors. The new map isn't that bad, it's a graphical style I personally dislike.

the idea when they made the new hud was "clarity" I don't see and bloody clarity, I see a jumble of crap In the bottom right corner that now takes 10x longer to read and understand.

"clarity? is that what you spilt in the sink riot?"

Despite now the game outright displays more stats of your character without having to bring up an ingame window like previously to display things such as CDR and Penetration numbers.

The game now displays ULT timers for your team mates.

The game now clusters together brilliantly things that you always need to be looking at such as the map and scores.

I've been playing games for around 24 years. I have a hell of a lot of experience in MOBAs starting with the original build of DOTA in StarCraft.
The new HUD for LoL is objectionably the best I've ever experienced.
they play because they like the moba, doesn't mean they like the map or HUD, I dislike the HUD(stupid and cramped, the idea of clarity went down the damn drain), but I liked the map
ill get drunk too that post
https://encrypted-tbn2.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTodoqIN26hzznZU8BgryfiCL6vATNrAY6B5_P3EmGidKOpFxs7Jg

The SR visual update was nice though, not sure why some wound dislike it in the first place. 

The only gameplay aspect of the new rift I am not a big fan of is the Dragon reward change.

Haven't played the game for a while, not sure why the HUD change might be bad for a few people.

I've been comparing it to previous versions of the HUD, and to HUDs from other MOBAs.

It's the best so far.

I disliked the summoners rift update, but I didn't say I would quit. However it is the skill, strategy and gameplay not that graphics that interests me.

I still prefer the Season 4 map.
I dont understand why riot cant just make the two differing HUDS as an option in configuration.  Would suit everyone.
